intro: Scabiosa comosa var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese scabious, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
